resources.string: Please choose one of the Bitmojis bellow as your companion. The bitmoji will reflect your state throughout the experiment changing everyday depending on your answers to the questionnaire.

In order to proceed with the experiment, we will kindly ask you to look over the next paragraphs to understand your involvement into this study. Please initial the box(es) if you agree with the statement(s):
I have read and understood the information sheet (20/07/2018 /Version 1.0) and have had the opportunity to ask questions about the study.
I agree to take part in this research project and agree for my data to be used for the purpose of this study.
I understand my participation is voluntary and I may withdraw at any time for any reason without my rights being affected.
I understand my responses will be anonymised in reports of the research.
I understand that I may be quoted directly in reports of the research but that my name will not be used.
I understand that the information collected about me may be anonymised and used in future ethically approved research studies.

I understand that information collected about me during my participation in this study will be stored on a password protected computer and that this information will only be used for the purpose of ethically approved research studies.
Would you agree on being contacted after the study in regards to possible outcomes/ in order to provide insights from your experience of participating in this experiment?
First, how would you rate the following aspects of your sleep and daily experience? 1 represents the lowest and 5 the highest.

For the question \"How quickly do you usually fall asleep?\", please bare in mind that 1 means \"as soon as getting into bed\", 2 is \"within 20 minutes\", 3 is \"up to one hour\", 4 is \"1/1.30 hours\" and 5 is \"more than that\". Also, for the \"How easily do you usually wake up?\", notice that 1 means \"waking up with no alarm\", 2 is \"using the alarm only sometimes\", 3 is \"using the alarm but I get up easily\", 4 is \"using the snooze button once\", 5 is \"using the snooze button more than once\".

For the question \"How easily did you fall asleep last night?\", please bare in mind that 1 means \"as soon as got into bed\", 2 is \"within 20 minutes\", 3 is \"up to one hour\", 4 is \"1/1.30 hours\" and 5 is \"more than that\". Also, for the \"How easily did you wake up this morning?\", notice that 1 means \"woke up with no alarm\", 2 is \"used the alarm\", 3 is \"used the alarm and hit snooze\", 4 is \"used the snooze button more than once\", 5 is \"could not wake up even wih alarm\".
How many times do you wake up per night in average?
Do you ever have night terrors? If yes, how many times a week?
How quickly do you usually fall asleep?
How easily do you usually wake up?
How fresh do you usually feel after you wake up?
How happy do you usually feel during the day?
How sad do you usually feel during the day?
How sleepy do you usually feel during the day?
How tired do you usually feel during the day?
How stressed do you usually feel during the day?
How irritable do you usually feel during the day?
How hard is for you to concentrate during the day?
How hard is for you to coordinate your activities during the day?
How would you usually rate your appetite during the day?
Do you have any other notes you wish to add into your Goal Diary?
How would you rate the following aspects of your day? 1 represents the lowest and 5 the highest.
How many times did you wake up last night?
How many night terrors did you have last night?
How easily did you fall asleep last night?
How easily did you wake up this morning?
How fresh did you feel after you woke up today?
How happy did you feel today?
How sad did you feel today?
How sleepy did you feel today?
How tired did you feel today?
How stressed did you feel today?
How irritable did you feel today?
How hard was for you to concentrate today?
How hard was for you to coordinate your activities today?
How would you rate your appetite for today?

GREAT! My name is Alex and I will do this experiment together with you. As your companion, I will reflect your mood. I can see you are ok at the moment. That is great! We will work together to keep it like this and even improve your state.

GREAT! My name is Alex and I will do this experiment together with you. As your companion, I will reflect your mood. I see that you feel blue. We will work together to make you feel better and you will see, it is not hard at all.
Please input either a goal, a wish, or any note. You can return to this section later.

These are the next factors and associated experiments that impact your sleep hygiene. The chosen experiment is the one you chose to follow. Please bare in mind that after clicking Submit you will only be able to change the experiment after 5 days.

Here you can mark which experiments you wish to undertake in terms of the LIGHT factor. You can also choose your own personalised behavior by clicking on PERSONALISED and having access to information.
Increase bright light exposure during the day
Wear glasses that block blue light during the night.
Turn off any bright lights 2 hours before going to bed (such as TV/the computer etc).
You currently have no personalised plan for this factor.

Here you can mark which experiments you wish to undertake in terms of the CAFFEINE factor. You can also choose your own personalised behavior by clicking on PERSONALISED and having access to information.
Do not drink caffeine within 6 hours before sleep
Limit yourself to 4 cups of coffees per day; 10 cans of coke/fanta; 2 energy drinks
Do not drink caffeine on empty stomach

Here you can mark which experiments you wish to undertake in terms of the SLEEP SCHEDULE factor. You can also choose your own personalised behavior by clicking on PERSONALISED and having access to information.
Usually get up at the same time everyday, even on weekends/vacations
Sleep no less than 7 hours per night
Do not go to bed unless you are tired. If you are not, relax with a bath/by reading a book before bed
Go to sleep at 22:30 PM the latest
Welcome to your Goal Diary! Here you will able to note any particular changes you want to reflect on/any goals you wish to accomplice and any other observations. You can also see previous notes.
Do you think you feel better than yesterday?
Your current experiment is: INCREASE BRIGHT LIGHT EXPOSURE DURING THE DAY. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you get sunlight exposure in the morning?
Did you stay at least half an hour in the sun today?
Did you keep your room so that it captures sunlight?
Your current experiment is: STOP WATCHING THE TV/THE COMPUTER WITHIN 2 HOURS OF GOING TO SLEEP. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you watch TV or stayed on the computer with 2 hours before going to bed?
Your current experiment is: TURN OFF ANY BRIGHT LIGHT WITHIN 2 HOURS OF GOING TO SLEEP. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you turn off any bright lights in your room with 2 hours before going to bed?
Your current experiment is: WEAR GLASSES THAT BLOCK ANY LIGHT DURING THE NIGHT. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you use the f.lx app on the computer during the day?
Did you use any glasses to block blue light during the night?
Your current experiment is: DO NOT DRINK CAFFEINE ON EMPTY STOMACH. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you drink any caffeine today?
If yes, did you do it on empty stomach?
Your current experiment is: LIMIT YOURSELF TO 4 CUPS OF COFFEE PER DAY; 10 CANS OF SODA; 2 ENERGY DRINKS. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
How many cups of coffee did you have today?
How many cans of soda did you have today?
How many energy drinks did you have today?
Your current experiment is: DO NOT DRINK CAFFEINE WITHIN 6 HOURS OF GOING TO SLEEP. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
When did you have your last drink of caffeine? (soda/coffee/energy drink)
When did you go to sleep?

Your current experiment is: DO NOT GO TO BED UNLESS YOU ARE TIRED. IF YOU ARE NOT, RELAX WITH A BATH/READING A BOOK BEFORE BED. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Did you go to sleep fully relaxed/ready to sleep?
What activity of the next did you do before going to sleep?
Your current experiment is: GET UP AT THE SAME TIME EVERYDAY, EVEN ON WEEKENDS/VACATIONS. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.
Your current experiment is: SLEEP NO LESS THAN 7 HOURS PER NIGHT. Below you are asked to complete the questions on whether you followed the experiment.

The Calendar shows your progress in time. You will find that ecah day since the beginning of the experiment will be coloured in a representative way: the darker the red, the worse your state was/ the darker the green, the better your state was. By clicking on a specific date you will be able to se the overall mood, the experiment and the comments for that day.
Sleep Better works towards a tuning process over your sleeping patterns
You can ask Alex questions about sleep hygiene and other cool, interesting facts about sleep. For fun, you can also ask your companion to tell you a joke. just give it a try and have some fun!
Tuning - a process that works for you

What these sleep experiments are for, is to test the options that might work best for you to sleep better. You already sleep every day so you already have lots of practice sleeping - the goal in these experiments is to help you dial in ways that will help you sleep better.

According to National Sleep Foundations, sleep hygiene is a variety of different practices and habits that are necessary to have good nighttime sleep quality and full daytime alertness. Obtaining healthy sleep is important for both physical and mental health. It can also improve productivity and overall quality of life. Everyone, from children to older adults, can benefit from developing a good sleep practice.

Our mission with Sleep Better is to help you and guide you through a series of experiments that are proved to let you explore sleep hygiene. The Sleep Better app offers an easy-to-use, straightforward, friendly interface for you to use that would not only drive you through a self-experimentation tuning process but also help us identify the most impactful factors over your sleeping hygiene.

Welcome! Sleep Better is a mobile application that guides you through a series of experiments that you can run in a definite period of time in order to start a tuning process over your sleeping patterns. You will be able to change/choose your experiment once every 5 days, where at the end of each day you will have to log on your experience. You will also be able to analyse the data and interact with the other features of the app. To begin with, please select a companion, complete the consent form, input your name (that only YOU will be able to see), and your given participant number.

You can ask for more information on the following topics: Blue Screen, Caffeine, Circadian Rhythms, Energy drinks, etc! Simply ask your companion: \"Tell me about...\" and complete the question with one of the topics. You can also ask your companion for random facts about sleep: \"Tell me a fact\"! And do not forget to start with a Hi!

For the duration of the self-experimentation study, you will be able to choose which experiments you wish to conduct among the 10 options you have. At every 5 days, you will be required to either change the experiment or stick with it for another 5 days. You will be able to look at the data concerning your well-being in the DATA meu.

At the end of each day, you will be required to complete 2 short questionnaires (2-3 minutes in total) that would look at both how you approached the experiment in that day AND what is the outcome. The experiment logging asks you to rate whether you feel better/worse than yesterday, but also to answer a short series of questions on how you approached the chosen experiment (1-3 questions).

By easily navigating through the Sleep Better menu you can access each category that helps you explore your self-experimentation.
 
 FACTORS helps you choose you preffered experiment, at every 5 days.
 
 GOAL DIARY keeps track of every note you save regarding your experience. You are free to add whatever observation you might have at anytme. 
 
 DATA gives you insights on how your well-being changed for the duration of the experiments - you can look at graphs, progress bars and current states. 
 
 QUESTIONNAIRE will only be able to be accessed at the end of each day, when you will be asked to log in your status. 
 
 CALENDAR will look on your progress throughout the experiment, where colors suggest your overall well-being for the day. You are also able to look at the status of that day by clicking on it. 
 
 HELP represents the Chatbot, that can help you by answering short questions about the experiments, the terms we are using and any other curiosity - check the Chatbot Guide on the first page.
Start the conversation with a Hi, and then ask me about sleep hygiene topics (check the guide if you are not sure). If I do not reply, make sure you are connected to the internet.
